I do not think it a violation

He said his attack bombers had knocked off so many Japanese
locomotives that the Japs non run their trains only at night and during
the day-time hide the loconotives in the woods.
We left on the 15th for Chungking on the regular CNAC passenger
plane-a
very little converted freight plane in which all the paasengers

Inflation runs riot.
Rice-which formerly cost NC$6 per pieul now

merchants would prefer not

I could not get
any constructive or dafinite program from anyone, and while I do not pretend

"Good" money of any kind disappears
like water on sand.
Prices for anthing of intrinsic value are absurdly
bigh-for example a Parker 51 fountain pen can be sold for US $100--an old
